column4: is there any way I can revert the last updates the update manager did? it totally borked up my display
any way I can force it to the higher resolution? 1024x768 is just terrible with a high-rez lcd :(
reinstall your video drivers
you mean uninstall and reinstall?
whatever you did to get the display nice, do it again
it's always been nice until I let the update thing run
ok, what is the output of: lspci | grep -i vga
02:00.0 VGA compatible controller: nVidia Corporation GeForce 8600 GT (rev a1)
sudo apt-get --purge remove nvidia*; sudo apt-get --purge autoremove; sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg; sudo apt-get clean; sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-180
then reboot
simply put, remove everything nvidia, then reinstall it
I reinstalled everything according to your command, and now I get get 1360x768, but I should be able to get 1680x1050
then you will need to run: gksudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf    and add the modeline
there are no resolutions in that file at all
then run:   gksudo nvidia-settings
and set a res, then click "write to xorg.conf"
it will then populate
reopen the file and manually edit it
no, the monitor will be detected for you
my crt doesnt rreport modelines so i must populate the file manually
use my xorg.conf as a template (http://pastebin.com/f2754732c) then change the refresh rates and resolutions as you need
